intro: The Web Docs project proposes a unified structure for documenting web projects. It breaks down documentation into three distinct specifications: general documentation options, static manifests (schema/API), and usage examples (cases).

specs.title: Doc Spec
specs.description: Defines general options for how a project or module is documented and displayed. This includes configuration for documentation generators, layout preferences, and content organization.

specs.title: Manifest Spec
specs.description: A superset of the Custom Elements Manifest (CEM). It statically extracts details from modules, including components, behaviors, and directives. This ensures tools can discover API surfaces without executing code.

specs.title: Cases Spec
specs.description: Defines specific usage cases for the module. These are declarative scenarios that serve as both documentation examples and potential integration tests source inputs.
specs.note: There is a close relationship between this spec and testing. Usage cases defined here can be consumed by test runners to verify component behavior in various states.
